Content:: The groove for transverse sinus is a groove which runs along the internal surface of the occipital bone, running laterally between the superior and inferior fossae of the cruciform eminence. The transverse sinuses travel along this groove. Base of the skull. Upper surface. Groove for transverse sinus labelled at bottom. Base of the skull. Upper surface. Transverse sinuses are drawn at bottom. This article incorporates text in the public domain from page 130 of the 20th edition of Gray's Anatomy (1918)  This human musculoskeletal system article is a stub.
